text: So the thing is that we know now, ever since evolution and developmental biology is that this, this sort of standard modern adult human, which features so prominently in the stories of, you know, philosophy 101, all of these things they talk about, you know, humans do this and we do that, but, but, but actually, we know that we are at the. At the center of several continua. These are. These are continuous, slow processes that got us from a single cell on an evolutionary scale or a developmental scale. And whatever you say about this, as far as the ability to truly understand, the ability to have moral worth, to have responsibilities, to have credit and blame and all those sorts of things, whatever this magical agential glow is that modern standard humans have, you, you would have to be able to tell a story of how it got here slowly and gradually from these continua.
content_summary: The speaker discusses the concept of human development and evolution, emphasizing that humans are at the center of several continuous, slow processes that have evolved from a single cell. The speaker also touches on philosophical aspects such as moral worth, responsibilities, and the ability to understand.
